snippet: A Mississippi Confederate battle flag is removed for a renovation of a House hallway, and it might never return.
abstract: Congressional Memo; Mississippi state flag with Confederate symbol is quietly taken down from hallway in Rayburn House Office Building on Capitol Hill, even as other Confederate symbols remain throughout United States Capitol grounds; removal of flag was ostensibly to accommodate renovations, and Congressional Republicans are hoping Mississippi Legislature will follow through on plans to redesign flag, rendering controversy over flag's removal moot.
lead_paragraph: A Mississippi Confederate battle flag is removed for a renovation of a House hallway, and it might never return.

headline.main: A Bit of Housekeeping Removes a Confederate Flag in a U.S. Capitol Building
headline.print_headline: A Bit of Housekeeping May Have Cleaned Up a Messy House Dispute
